Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans are made willing by their inner person to perform a certain task
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= woven material, dyed reddish purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish
= woven material, dyed reddish purple with a substance obtained from the murex shellfish
= crimson yarn, made with a dye derived from a small worm; ≈ associated with the process of atonement for sin and uncleanness

= high quality woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of cloth and clothes; worn by the rich and by priests; used for the construction of the tabernacle; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness
= goat's hair used for weaving cloth
= the skin or hide of an animal prepared by special processes to remove the hair and to keep it from decaying or becoming brittle

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
= causative action by which humans give an object a red color, ◄ either by painting or dying
= the skin or hide of an animal prepared by special processes to remove the hair and to keep it from decaying or becoming brittle

= large animal of about 3 meters (10 feet) long, which lives in the sea, usually in small herds of twelve to fifteen animals; they swim slowly and feed in fairly shallow water on underwater weeds near mouths of rivers; they sometimes even move a short distance up the river; they need to come to the surface every few minutes to breathe, and they sometimes come out of the water to lie on rocks or sandbanks;◄ |iDugong dugong|i*; ► their skins make very good leather
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

= a desert tree, reaching a height of 3 5 m, with a wide crown; it has sharp spines, finely divided leaves, and tiny pale yellow flowers arranged in drooping bunches; it produces a bean pod that is twisted and looped when dry; ◄ a member of the Mimosa family, Acacia tortilis or Acacia raddiana; ► its wood is used for construction

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= object that produces or reflects light

= generic terms for spices and aromatics, but sometimes specifically: fragrant resin ◄ produced by the balsam tree; ► used as ingredient for anointing oil and fragrant incense, and as perfume; ≈ considered very valuable

= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness
= oil that is used for anointing objects and people
= substance ◄ made from tree gum or bark ► to make a sweet smell; it is burned in a censer or on an open fire ≈ to provide a sweet aroma pleasing to God
= small object ◄ consisting of a variety of stone that is considered precious because of its beauty and scarcity; ► used as ornament or decoration; ≈ association with honor, majesty, and glory
= (semi )precious stone with straight layers of a white color, alternating with black, brown, or red; ◄ possibly variety of chalcedony: onyx
= small object ◄ consisting of a variety of stone that is considered precious because of its beauty and scarcity; ► used as ornament or decoration; ≈ association with honor, majesty, and glory
= a piece of metal in which a precious stone or gem is fixed to form a piece of jewellery

= embroidered garment; reaching from the shoulders to the waist; ◄ made from linen; ► worn by the high priest (כֹּהֵן) over his robe (מְעִיל) representing the visible glory of God; associated with divine oracles as the urim and tummim were kept in a pouch worn on top of it; this garment was regarded as unique and not to be duplicated and used outside of regulated worship

= kind of pouch; square; decorated with 12 precious stones, engraved with the names of the twelve tribes of Israel; ◄ made of cloth; ► worn by the high priest on his chest, on top of the ephod, and containing the urim and thummim
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a portable construction, also referred to as the Tent of the Testimony or the Tent of Meeting, ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used to put the ark of the covenant with the stone tablets on which the testimony was written, before Solomon's temple was built

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

= wooden box, overlaid with gold and with a golden cover with cherubs, normally placed behind the veil in the tabernacle or temple, but also carried along during military campaigns; ► symbolizing the presence of YHWH among his people and used to store the two tablets with the law of God and other objects representing important events in the history of Israel
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

= a desert tree, reaching a height of 3 5 m, with a wide crown; it has sharp spines, finely divided leaves, and tiny pale yellow flowers arranged in drooping bunches; it produces a bean pod that is twisted and looped when dry; ◄ a member of the Mimosa family, Acacia tortilis or Acacia raddiana; ► its wood is used for construction

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm
= one half of a measure
= the greater or greatest of two or more dimensions of an object

= long, slender piece of wood; ◄ made from a straight branch or tree; ► used for carrying objects or for locking gates from the inside
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

= a desert tree, reaching a height of 3 5 m, with a wide crown; it has sharp spines, finely divided leaves, and tiny pale yellow flowers arranged in drooping bunches; it produces a bean pod that is twisted and looped when dry; ◄ a member of the Mimosa family, Acacia tortilis or Acacia raddiana; ► its wood is used for construction
= causative action by which someone covers an object with a layer of (precious) metal, wood, glaze, or with precious stones

literally: palm of the hand; hence: = a relatively flat and shallow container for incense
